              Megaswitch patterns
              BETA
            
          
        
        
        The Mega Switch (also known as a Segmented Control) allows users to select one option from a small, mutually exclusive set. It presents all available options inline and emphasizes quick comparison and switching without navigating away or opening a menu.This component is best suited for mode switching, filtering, or view toggling where all options are equally important and immediately available.

DescriptionBoth variants are used to present equally important choices to the user.Maximum amount of nodes inside a megaswitch is 3 (three)The nodes can contain an optional iconContent GuidelinesLabel format for the the nodes can vary and consist of both a combination of  <Action verb> <context noun> or just the <context noun>.It is important that the label on all nodes matches the selected format.An optional icon can be added to the nodes but follows the same logic and has to be present on either all nodes or none.

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

AccessibilityIn order to adhere to accessibility guidelines, the megaswitch should keep it's dimensions across various screen sizes and ignore the scaling of the spacing variables that is otherwise taking place in less interactive components and layouts.Do’s and Don’ts✅ DoUse for fast, reversible choicesUse clear, concise labelsKeep all options equally weightedUse for filtering or mode switching❌ Don’tDon’t use for navigation between pagesDon’t mix actions and statesDon’t use for multi-select scenariosDon’t hide critical functionality behind it
